description.narrative: BFC strategic Phase III (2016 – 2018) is aiming to contribute to improving lives of at least 500,000 workers, their families and communities, and boost competitiveness in the Cambodian garment and footwear factories. BFC will achieve this vision by achieving the following Outcomes: Outcome 1 Cambodian exporting factories in the garment and footwear sector will have strengthened their capacity to improve and uphold compliance with the labour law. Outcome 2 BFC will have strengthened its engagement with the Cambodian government to improve their capacity to identify, non-compliance issues, strengthen enforcement, and uphold labour standards. Outcome 3 BFC will have strengthened its engagement and partnerships with key stakeholders for increased influence and impact on working conditions in factories and the systemic issues in the sector as a whole Outcome 4 BFC will have used its experience and data to inform and influence practices and policies related to responsible business practices in the industry Outcome 5 BFC will have strengthened its governance and management for increased sustainability

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 7.2. Increased capacity of member States to ensure safe and healthy working conditions

transaction.ref: KHM/18/51/MUL-2019-KHM227 - More women, men, youth and vulnerable groups in Cambodia have access to safe and healthy working conditions
